briefTitle: SONOlysis in Risk REduction of Symptomatic and Silent Brain infarCtions dUring Cardiac surgEry

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* age 40-90 years,
* sufficient temporal bone window for TCD with detectable blood flow in MCA,
* independent patient (modified Rankin score 0-2),
* informed consent signed by the patient,
* CS will be performed as an elective surgery with an extracorporeal circulation

Exclusion Criteria:

* contra-indication for MRI examination (pace-maker, implanted metal material, claustrophobia),
* emergent surgery,
* acute myocardial infarction,
* combined cardiac surgery,
* combined cardiac and carotid surgery

outcomeMeasures.title: Number od Participants With New Brain Infarction in the Monitored MCA Territory Detected Using MRI
outcomeMeasures.description: to demonstrate a twenty-percent risk reduction of number and volume of brain infarctions and brain infarctions \> 0.5 cm3 in the monitored MCA territory in sonolysis group detected using MRI examination 24 hours after cardiac surgery in 5% level of statistical significance

outcomeMeasures.title: Cognitive Decline
outcomeMeasures.description: To demonstrate an effect of sonolysis on the reduction of cognitive decline after cardiac surgery measured by Adenbook´s Cognitive Examination - revised (ACE-R)ACE-R. Adenbook´s Cognitive Examination - revised (ACE-R) can aquire value 0 to 100. Higher value represents better cognitive functions.

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Participants With Clinical Manifested Brain Infarction
outcomeMeasures.description: to demonstrate an effect of sonolysis on the reduction of risk of clinically stroke due to the activation of endogenous fibrinolytic system during cardiac surgery
